1067021.plot: The Glasgow Orpheus Choir sings 'Isle of Mull', 'The Campbells Are Coming', a Purcell arrangement, and 'Down in a Flowery Vale'.

1067026.title: A Feast of Harmony
1067026.plot: The Glasgow Orpheus Choir sings 'Londonderry Air' and 'Loch Lomond'.

1067030.title: Loose Ends
1067030.plot: 'A woman reporter is blackmailed for knowledge of freed suspect's involvement in a murder.' (British Film Institute)

1067035.title: The Woodpigeon Patrol
1067035.plot: 'Adventures of Boy Scout patrol.' (British Film Catalogue)

1067059.title: The Middle Watch
1067059.plot: 'Captain tries to hide accidental female passengers from admiral.' (British Film Catalogue)

1067067.title: Thread o' Scarlet
1067067.plot: 'Innocent blacksmith hanged on circumstantial evidence.' (British Film Catalogue)

1067072.title: Circus Daze
1067072.plot: Bingo, a cartoon dog, joins the circus.

1067180.title: Bingo Breaks Loose
1067180.plot: Bingo, a cartoon dog, breaks out of prison.

1067181.title: Bingo the Battling Bruiser
1067181.plot: 'Spurred on by his girlfriend, Bingo the dog decides to enter for a £500 challenge boxing match with prizefighter Samson.' (British Film Institute)

1067278.title: Claude Deputises: A Comedy Interlude
1067278.plot: 'A silly ass deputises as pianist for a singer.' (British Film Institute)

1067352.title: Two Way Street
1067352.plot: 'Bird fancier's daughter loves nobleman whom her cockney fiancé robs of necklace.' (British Film Catalogue)

1072399.title: The Crooked Billet
1072399.plot: 'International spy seeks documents hidden in old inn.' (British Film Catalogue)

1072406.title: The Second Kiss
1072406.plot: 'Romantic story of a gallant adventurer at the Court of Maria Teresa.' (The Bioscope)

1072440.title: Lord Richard in the Pantry
1072440.plot: 'Poor lord poses as butler to avoid framed arrest for theft.' (British Film Catalogue)

1072447.title: Cross Roads
1072447.plot: 'Mother thwarts daughter's elopement with story of how wife shot her errant husband.' (British Film Catalogue)

1072813.title: A Royal Flush
1072813.plot: A maid masquerades as a countess in order to help her lion-hunting mistress.

1072821.title: A Trip to Paris
1072821.plot: Bobby Jarvis and Eloise Taylor, a scrapping married couple, enter a newspaper essay contest on Happy Marriage, and win a trip to Paris.

1072836.title: Accidents Will Happen
1072836.plot: A store owner, faking injuries after an auto accident, is rehearsed for court by his shady lawyer.

1072846.title: Peruvian soul
1072846.plot: The film is a melodrama that tells the story of a couple who live misadventures. The heroes will have to go through different scenarios, such as hills, factory and penitentiary.

1072849.title: Alpine Echoes
1072849.plot: A baritone mountain climber visits a Swiss inn, where he sings to raise money for an aging singer.

1072851.title: American Woman
1072851.plot: The action of the film takes place during the Russian Revolution of 1905 in Moscow. King Okhranka tries to disrupt the work of the illegal printing press of the Bolsheviks. The small typewriter “Amerikanka” plays the key role in the victory.

1072853.title: Bold Love
1072853.plot: Malatroff, head of an international gang of jewel thieves, pressures Lucy Stavrin to pose as a countess and become friendly with the Corbetts, a nouveau-riche American couple residing on the Costa Azul.

1072859.title: An Old Flame
1072859.plot: An Old Flame is a 1930 Krazy Kat short directed by Manny Gould and Ben Harrison.

1072861.title: And How
1072861.plot: Musical short focusing on the American Indians of New York before the city's founding.

1072866.title: Arajin tcharagaytnere
1072866.plot: About everyday life in a pioneer camp.

1072869.title: Asakusa kurenaidan
1072869.plot: Describes the decadent allure of the entertainment district, Tokyo's Montmartre, where beggars and teenage prostitutes mixed with revue dancers and famous authors.

1072872.title: Ashes
1072872.plot: Futuristic story about a slow moving cricket match that begins in 1940 (ten years beyond the year when the film was produced) and finally finishes in 2000.

1072947.title: Gaucho soul
1072947.plot: Elsa, a young girl from Buenos Aires, visits her aunt and uncle, Don Alfredo and Doña Cristina, at their ranch. While playing golf, Elsa meets a gaucho, Antonio, and is enchanted by his exquisite singing voice.

1072952.title: Thus is Life
1072952.plot: A British ex-Grenadier Guards officer moves to America, but struggles to find work. After he is employed as a chauffeur to a wealthy family, he falls in love with his employer's daughter.

1072958.title: To life and death
1072958.plot: Eddie, a muscular circus performer, catch one night a burglar. It is Paul who is stealing from his wealthy sister Eveline. He needs money for his opium abuse, caused by the unscrupulous dealer Van Straaten.

1072966.title: The doctor's secret
1072966.plot: Lillian Garson, a woman of noble English ancestry who is married to a commoner, has written a letter to her husband, ending their marriage.

1072967.title: Bar-L Ranch
1072967.plot: Bob Tyler (Buffalo Bill Jr.) has rustler trouble while driving a herd of cattle to the new owner, but he refuses to turn the herd over to Frank Kellogg (Wally Wales). He has a run-in with Jean Polk (Betty Baker), discovers she is the owner of the cattle, and is fired. With his friend, Barney McCool (Ben Corbett), Bob snoops around and discovers that Kellogg is behind the rustling.

1072968.title: Bearcat Runs Wild
1072968.plot: After chasing away an artist in a pasteural setting, a man dressed in a bear costume gets acquainted with the artist's two beautiful female models, offers them booze and cigarettes, and cuddles with them.

1073348.title: Beyond the Law
1073348.plot: A border saloon - half in California, half in Nevada - is a hangout for frontier gangs.

1073350.title: Beyond the Rio Grande
1073350.plot: Having quit their old gang and gone straight, Bert Allen and Joe Kemp finally own their own ranch after three years, but Joe robs the Riverton bank of the Green River Dam payroll - using Bert's horse, gun and gloves and leaving behind Bert's hat.

1073355.title: Big Hearted
1073355.plot: Elmer and Fannie Blue (Ray Hughes and Dorothy Gulliver) are happy that their neighbors in the duplex apartment next door, that shares an interior wall, have vacated and are looking forward to having newer and nicer neighbors. Then, Oscar Black and his wife (Harry Gribbon and Vivien Oakland, who was billed as Vivian Oakland) move in

1073356.title: Big Money
1073356.plot: In the fifth of WB's Potter Family series, based on the characters created by J.P.McAvoy, Pa Potter (Lucien Littlefield) gets a job as a professional divorce-case correspondent. He is hired by a lawyer to make love to the wife of a man seeking a divorce. The problem is that Pa forgets to tell Ma (Lucille Ward) it is all make-believe.

1073361.title: Fire Revenge
1073361.plot: On the struggle of artisanal peasants against the economic oppression by the kulaks.

1073665.title: Bratishkin sorevnuetsya
1073665.plot: About socialist competition in the Red Army.

1074647.title: Bridal Night
1074647.plot: A couple is stranded in a supposedly haunted house.

1074650.title: Sound Effects
1074650.plot: Juvenile drummer, Buddy Traps [sic], later known as Buddy Rich, taps out harmony out of a wide assortment of objects, from drums to bottles, can, chairs, and whatnot.

1074651.title: Stormy Youth
1074651.plot: Boris and Nina are in love. He is the son of a wealthy merchant, she - just an ordinary seamstress. Boris's Father opposes their love.

1074652.title: Call of the Circus
1074652.plot: A retired circus clown, Herbert Rawlinson, finds love entering his life when he marries a member of the circus troupe, Ethel Clayton and the adoption of an orphaned circus girl, Joan Wyndham. Later his wife thinks he does not love her and she leaves him. He embarks on a quest to win her back.

1074654.title: Call of the Desert
1074654.plot: Tod Walker takes Rex Carson's map to a gold mine and leaves him in the desert. Carson recuperates at Jean Walker's ranch and she takes a liking to him. But when her uncle Tod arrives, he claims Carson tried to jump his claim. She sides with her uncle and Carson, banished from the Walker ranch, sets out to get his claim back.

116624.title: Outside the Law
116624.plot: Fingers is planning a half-million-dollar bank robbery in gang boss Cobra Collins' territory. Fingers' moll Connie tries to bluff Cobra into thinking the hit won't be for another week when the call comes through saying it's now.

116639.title: The Naughty Flirt
116639.plot: A coquettish socialite falls for a straight-laced associate in her father's law firm. But she must also fend off the advances of a greedy fortune-hunter and his sister.

116861.title: Her Man
116861.plot: A sex worker yearns to leave the grimy underground community she was born into, and sees her way out through a sympathetic sailor.

117591.title: Experimental Treatment of a Hemorrhage in a Dog
117591.plot: Jean Painleve short about an experimental canine surgery.

1074813.title: Curmudgeon
1074813.plot: An irascible retired old lawyer exposes a diamond thief.

1074818.title: Charros, gauchos y manolas
1074818.plot: The magazine "Paintings of the People" initiates a contest to select the best watercolor painting of ethnic peoples and customs. A hungry bohemian painter invokes his muse to help him to produce the winning painting, and when he experiments with scenes set in Mexico, Argentina and Spain, his paintings come to life. In Xochimilco, Mexico, a young bachelor has a drunken dream that his girl friend is performing Josephine Baker's famous banana dance in a Parisian nightclub. In Buenos Aires, an Italian and a Galician are rivals for the affections of a Creole girl. At the other side of the Hispanic world, a Sevillian girl tells of her tragic romance with a matador, who obstinately continues to appear in the ring despite having been injured.

1075707.title: Black Days
1075707.plot: About the peasant uprising in the Poltava region in 1905.

1075708.title: Black Skin
1075708.plot: A Black American worker travels to the USSR and experiences the racial solidarity of Soviet life.

1075710.title: Cinema Girl
1075710.plot: This film presented a fictionalized biography of its maker. One of the major characters is a producer modeled on Kohinoor's proprietor, D.N. Sampat, including a reference to the real life occasion when the studio, on the verge of bankruptcy, survived only because its employees donated money and gold ornaments to keep it afloat. Another character referred to a financier at the Imperial Studio. The plot also touched on the way a producer can curtail the freedom of a director.

1075713.title: College Capers
1075713.plot: A musical revue contrasts the long ago graduation ceremonies of 1910 with their modern counterparts of 1930.

1075719.title: Convict's Code
1075719.plot: Just before the scheduled electrocution of stockbroker Kenneth Avery for the murder of Mazie Lawrence, Nan Perry makes one last plea to the governor for a stay of execution and relates the incidents that led to Mazie's death.

1076737.title: Covered Wagon Trails
1076737.plot: Deputy Sheriff "Smoke" Sanderson (Bob Custer) is after a gang of smugglers, led by Brad Vogel (J.P. McGowan) operating along the Texas/Mexico border but he does not know that Chet Clayton (Perry Murdock), the brother of his sweetheart, Wanda Clayton (Phyllis Bainbridge), is one of the gang members.

1076756.title: When Love Laughs
1076756.plot: José Mojica plays a singing vacquero who stops off in la cantina to have muchas cervezas with los muchachos. While José is all beered up, he boasts that he can tame the wild mare -- a horse no man can ride -- owned by local ranchero Don Alvarado (a stolid performance by Carlos Villarias). While he's in the neighbourhood, José also boasts that he can tame the Don's daughter, a Mexican spitfire played by Mona Maris.

1076761.title: Daily Mail
1076761.plot: This controversial film about the Daily Hindustan thinly disguised as the fictional Daily Mail, edited a character constructed as a composite portrait of Hindustan's owner Lotwala and editor Indulal Yagnik. It also lampooned the patron of the Ranjit Studio, Jamsaheb of Jamnagar, and his studio boss Chandulal Shah in a plot designed as a scabrous expose of the film industry's ethics.

1076763.title: Dear Old Southland
1076763.plot: A rare early forerunner of the music video, in which bass-baritone Jules Bledsoe is seen singing "Dear Old Southland", a song with new lyrics, but melody adapted from the famous spiritual "Deep River".

1076771.title: Common Clay
1076771.plot: A maid with a checkered past falls in love with the son in the posh household where she works, and gives him a baby.

1076772.title: The big day
1076772.plot: Follows the young couple, Vivi and Peter, who just want to enjoy their free time and the upcoming engagement as well as their families. The couple's parents are convinced Social Democrats who try to make it clear to the young people why the party's work is important. Through the meeting with a veteran from the war, the young people experience why both pacifism and agricultural reforms are the only way forward for Denmark.

1076806.title: A Buddhist Mass for Goemon Ishikawa
1076806.plot: The adventures of a modern day descendant of a famed Edo era thief are the basis for this short supernatural comedy romp.

1078407.title: The fight with the dragon or: The tragedy of the lodger
1078407.plot: A meek clerk can no longer abide the nastiness of his boarding house proprietress and takes drastic action.

1078410.title: The dance goes on
1078410.plot: This is the German-language version of 1930's "Those Who Dance", shot by Warner Bros. in Hollywood with a German-speaking cast.

1078677.title: Desert Sunk
1078677.plot: Riding a camel through the desert, Krazy Kat and his Minnie-Mouse lookalike girlfriend are spotted by one of the sultan's men, who kidnaps the girl for his boss's harem.

1078678.title: Desert Thrills
1078678.plot: A young couple in an Egyptian cafe become irritated with each other, but make up again with some song and dance.

1078680.title: Dining Out
1078680.plot: Comedy about a man who, reluctantly, spends an evening with his wife at home rather then going out drinking with his friend. When that friend later mistakes the wife for the girl he's been carousing with, it all gets a bit messy.

1078684.title: Daughter of Saint
1078684.plot: The story of Hakima, who becomes pregnant after being raped by the imam Abdu-Nabi. When, years later, the 'holy man' turns his gaze to his biological daughter Oinasa, Hakima attempts to protect her.

1078687.title: Don Dougio Fairabanca
1078687.plot: Parody of film star Douglas Fairbanks enacted by puppets.

1078746.title: Drumming It In
1078746.plot: Two employees of a drum manufacturer cause havoc when they visit their boss's country estate.

1078750.title: Easy Street
1078750.plot: Con artists try to trick an old man out of his life savings.

1079064.title: The Last of the Vargas
1079064.plot: A cowboy avenges his father's murder, but must flee the law as a result. He attempts the rescue of a young woman from an outlaw, but becomes entangled with the outlaw's wife.

1079096.title: Crashed
1079096.plot: A matinée idol and a bumbling manager fight for the love of a would-be starlet. Estrellados is essentially the Spanish version of Free and Easy with Hispanic/Spanish-speaking actors.

1079099.title: Ex-Flame
1079099.plot: A woman's uncontrollable jealousy over her husband's former girlfriend results in her losing not only her house but her young son is taken away from her.

1079100.title: Excuse the Pardon
1079100.plot: A convict is released, then lured back to prison, because he was pardoned by mistake.

1079117.title: Kiss Me, Maritsa
1079117.plot: Maritsa is a lively girl who finds it difficult to live in the village, with her uncle, who is also the President of the community. The son of a major industrialist is persuaded by Maritsa to take her to Athens with him.

1079119.title: Firebrand Jordan
1079119.plot: 'Firebrand' Jordan is a ranger sent into the high Sierras to assist the local Sheriff Ed Burns in capturing a mysterious band of counterfeiters.

1079121.title: For Two Cents
1079121.plot: DeWolf Hopper thinks he is on the verge of death and a couple of newspapers are bidding for the story rights. One of the newspapers is willing to pay a big sum if Hopper will kick off in time for its last edition of the day. Hopper plays the whole role in bed.

1079171.title: Gems of M-G-M
1079171.plot: Benny Rubin performs vaudeville routines between singing and dancing acts.

1079183.title: General Ginsberg
1079183.plot: Private Ginsberg (Nat Carr), is a Jewish soldier, in World War One, who is always falling into mud or grief. Along the way, he unconsciously, as a buck private, puts on the overcoat belonging to a General, and takes full advantage of the favorable situations he encounters, although he knows no reason why his status has changed.

1079185.title: Getting a Raise
1079185.plot: First in a series of shorts based on J. P. McEvoy's Tuttle Family characters. Pa Tuttle (Lucien Littlefield), with three kids to feed, strives to talk his skin-flint boss, (Dell Henderson), of a raise. Boss has an attitude that faithful employees should be happy just to be working for him.

1079188.title: For Her Love
1079188.plot: During WWI, two men vie for the attention of the same woman.

1079189.title: Blue Arctic Fox
1079189.plot: About the struggle of reindeer herders and hunters of the North with the dominance of kulaks and fur buyers.

1079190.title: Governor C.C. Young Hails Greater Talkie Season
1079190.plot: Ronald Colman introduces the governor of California, who urges moviegoers to attend the cleaner, wholesome talkie films, rather than those that show the seamy side of life. Doing this will show movie company executives that the public prefers them, and more of them will be produced.

1079191.title: Grounds for Murder
1079191.plot: A husband becomes infuriated when his wife and household staff abandon him as a result of their fixation with murder trials.

1079192.title: Mr. Elanto
1079192.plot: Jack Coski (Jaakko Koski) returns to Helsinki and gets impressed by co-op Elanto.

1079193.title: His Honor the Mayor
1079193.plot: Charles Murray is running for mayor. Opponent Eddie Baker has a young woman go into his shoe shop and, while changing stockings, say things that will alienate the women voters; Baker tells her it's a practical joke, and he'll get her boy friend out of jail.

1079194.title: His Public
1079194.plot: A henpecked husband is enamored with a lovely vaudeville singer. He goes out to see her act, and his son follows, intent to save his parent's marriage.

1079195.title: Honest Crooks
1079195.plot: A mysterious black bag, buried in a haystack by a couple of crooks, is found by Wildcat (Buck) and his pal Denny (Bubbles). It is full of money and when the guys try to return it, funny things happen.

1079198.title: Fist of a Cripple
1079198.plot: About the sufferings of the disabled, in a tone of intense social criticism.

1079199.title: Ikh ulitsa
1079199.plot: The worker's son Vlasik Lyakun lives without a mother. Because of his father's drunkenness, he shuns his comrades. But then he joins a pioneer organization.

1079412.title: It's All Over
1079412.plot: Saloon singer Marion is unappreciated by her ungrateful boyfriend, Bob, so she expresses her sorrow by singing a tear jerking ballad to a dreary clientele.

1079414.title: Cain and Abel
1079414.plot: In a small village, two very close brothers turn into sworn enemies over the hand of a beautiful Gypsy girl - and confront each other - with tragic consequences.

1079428.title: Knocking them Cold
1079428.plot: Idle chit-chat from some out-of-work actors in a boarding house.

1079429.title: Face of Desire
1079429.plot: Spanish-language version of The Big Fight (1930).

1079434.title: The legend of Wally
1079434.plot: A young girl flees from her father to be able to marry her true love.

1079437.title: Life in reverse
1079437.plot: Backman showed in 'La vie en l'envers' the comic effect of backward movements - a nail jumping out of a piece of wood to leap towards the hammer, a sandwich getting bigger instead of smaller in the mouth, liquid leaving the glass to fill up the bottle.

1079440.title: Capistrano's bells
1079440.plot: In the 1830s, the tyrannical Spanish governor in old California finds himself in the midst of a rebellion and is out to get the rebel leader. A senorita, whose father is being persecuted by the governor, sets out to deliver the rebel leader in exchange for her father's freedom...but she falls in love with him.

1079441.title: The ghosts
1079441.plot: Juanito gets locked out of his house in the middle of a windy night. Spanish language version of When the Wind Blows (1930)

1079445.title: Leave It to Lester
1079445.plot: Persuading his newlywed friends, Jerry and Marian Townsend, to take him along on their European honeymoon as guide, Lester Aloysius Sebastian Brown launches the threesome on a series of comic adventures, beginning in a Paris nightclub, where Lester is roughed up by two husbands who mistake his companions for their wives. Then on to Switzerland and a forced landing near a wedding festival; to Cairo, where Jerry is abducted and found by Marian in a harem; and back to New York.

1079446.title: Lem Putt, the Specialist
1079446.plot: A carpenter who specializes in building outhouses becomes successful, but then things take a turn for the worse when his name becomes synonymous with "toilet".

1079447.title: Let's Stay Single
1079447.plot: Frances Williams, chairman of a single girls club with a rapidly decreasing number of members explains her relations to men of the club.

1079449.title: Lily of Killarney
1079449.plot: A poor aristocrat hires a dwarf to drown his secret wife so he may marry an heiress.

1079452.title: Love Your Neighbor
1079452.plot: After a woman experiences what happens to her when she joins the "Do a Good Deed a Day" Club, she feels like murdering the president of the organization.

1079510.title: Marvels of Motion: A
1079510.plot: Slow-motion, reverse-motion, and trick photography adds extra amusement to scenes of galloping horses, leaping dogs, and various rodeo acts.

1079511.title: Mascot
1079511.plot: Feliks Promienski inherits from his aunt a small clay figurine representing a pagan god. And from that moment happiness begins to favor him. At races, while playing roulette and in love. At the races Feliks meets Beata .

1079513.title: In the Name of Humanity
1079513.plot: About a film studio director, who during the NEP years fights against the director of films designed for petty bourgeois tastes.

1079514.title: Model Women
1079514.plot: An insight into the gossip among window mannequins as they come to life when no one's watching.

1079516.title: The Model
1079516.plot: A young artist falls in love with the girl who poses for him.

1079518.title: Modern Business
1079518.plot: An up-to-date salesman shows a department store how to improve its business, to the strains of syncopation.

1079519.title: Monsieur Gazon
1079519.plot: Monsieur Gazon is not likely to win employee of the month: he is assuredly the worst salesman at the Galeries de Paris ! And, as the customers regularly complain he is regularly fired... and hired again ! This time, he has once again attracted the manager's attention by... courting his own fiancée!

1079520.title: Monsieur Le Fox
1079520.plot: Part of a gold shipment has been stolen and the Sergeant (Robert Elliott) suspects Louis LeBey (Gilbert Roland). When Louis is attracted to newly arrived Nedra Ruskin (Barbara Leonard), Woolie-Woolie (Nina Quartero) becomes jealous and tells the Sergeant where Louis hid the gold. First, Louis rescues the Sergeant whose dog team crashes chasing him and then he saves Nedra from an avalanche. When he returns the injured Nedra to the settlement, the Sergeant takes him prisoner.

1079521.title: Mr. Intruder
1079521.plot: A magazine editor gets a good story when he comes home to find his wife with his best friend.

1079525.title: My Mistake
1079525.plot: A hired gunman inadvertently targets an undertaker as his next victim, who talks the killer into leaving the undertaker's business card whenever he does his next job.

1079526.title: At a Dark Crossroads
1079526.plot: Goran and Kosan compete for the love of the beautiful peasant girl Lina. The more virtuous of two wins her heart.

1079528.title: The Double Adventure
1079528.plot: A young Italian couple are to marry for family business purposes. They defer this wedding for a year, but after meeting in Naples circumstances cause them to fall in love.

1079529.title: Our Girls
1079529.plot: About a brigade of young female turners who win the respect of the factory team by their labor.

1079530.title: Not Damaged
1079530.plot: A fortune teller informs a hopeless romantic that she'll be meeting a mysterious, tall, dark stranger. Initially skeptical, the young lady latterly concedes when the soothsayer's premonitions begin to ring true.

1079532.title: O Babão
1079532.plot: Zé Babão is a hillbilly who does not care about working, leads the good life of the interior and is in love with Conchita. One day, an Italian appears interested in all the banana trees of Zé Babão and, for this, decides to marry Conchita.

1079534.title: The Clown of Life
1079534.plot: A clown of the street falls in love with a girl with tuberculosis, and, trying to find a way to cure her, he takes her to a monastery. The clown returns to the street performances with the dream of meeting with the girl again.

1079537.title: Office Steps
1079537.plot: A satire on an ultra-modern, jazz-mad office; staid stenographers turn to singing and dancing, and dictation is given in rhyme.

1079538.title: Olimpia
1079538.plot: Spanish version of the MGM romance, His Glorious Night: in the old Austro-Hungarian empire, a princess rejects her arranged marriage and loves, instead, a dashing cavalry captain.

1079539.title: One Nutty Night
1079539.plot: Two correspondence school detectives attempt to apprehend a maniac on the loose and get him back to the asylum.

1079558.title: Only the Girl
1079558.plot: Vera Marsh and Buddy Wattles enact the differences between marriage proposals in the gay 90s and the 1930s.

1079559.title: When Love Hurts
1079559.plot: The film was supposed to be the first Greek-American movie, recounting a love story in Athens and America. Instead, it was an American film, enriched with minimal Greek scenes.

1079560.title: Paleface and Redskin, or, Handsome Men are Slightly Sunburnt
1079560.plot: Puppetry story about Tom Mixup and his horse "Stony".

1079561.title: Paper Hanging with Johnny Arthur
1079561.plot: A penny-pinching house-holder attempts to put up wallpaper without professional help.

1079563.title: Paramount on parade
1079563.plot: Dutch-language version of Paramount on Parade (1930) produced and released by Paramount Pictures.

1079564.title: Parisian Nights
1079564.plot: In a Parisian underworld bar, an American tourist is fascinated by the way an Apache Dancer treats his partner. Enchanted by his charm, she dances with him, and is robbed of her necklace, which her boyfriend recovers and the charm is broken.

1079566.title: Pathetic Gazette
1079566.plot: A short skit on the Irish legend of Cuchulain and Deirdre.

1079567.title: Peek-A-Boo
1079567.plot: Arthur Lake plays a bellhop whose dream is to become the house-detective at the hotel. A robbery at the hotel gives him his opportunity. And the chance to impress his girlfriend, the daughter of the hotel owner. Arthur doesn't walk through any walls in this one. Nor does anybody else.

1079569.title: Piccadilly Nights
1079569.plot: A girl singer makes good when the star is too drunk to appear.

1079577.title: Under the Eagle's Nest
1079577.plot: After completing his military service, Angel returns to his native village. Angel and beautiful Rada are in love. Gancho, the deformed son of a wealthy man, is seized by jealousy.

1079580.title: The Underground Sun
1079580.plot: On the struggle of the Donbas miners to eliminate the liquidation in the coal industry.

1079581.title: Politics
1079581.plot: An ambitious campaign manager makes friends, influences people and welcomes his long-lost mother to Ellis Island.

1079582.title: Purely an Accident
1079582.plot: A self-effacing prizefighter assumes a very different attitude once he hits the big time.

1079604.title: Radio Kisses
1079604.plot: Marjorie Beebe give advice to the lovelorn service over the air, but she almost fails when she tries to get a man of her own.

1079606.title: Railroad Follies
1079606.plot: A program of musical entertainers perform on a cross country train.

1079853.title: World Record
1079853.plot: Charles Cimier sneaks out with his friends Bisseron and Brossy to break a world record of speed on his bike behind a motorcycle. His mother fears the danger of his attempt.

1079854.title: Red Heads
1079854.plot: In this two-reel comic operetta, Nat Carr owns a gown shop in New York City and advertises for redheaded models--and is run over by a slew of redheaded applicants, including one who is a runaway heiress, who is followed by a short redheaded policewoman.

1079856.title: Red, Green and Yellow
1079856.plot: Husband and wife decide to carry on their arguing by red-light-green-light traffic lights.

1079857.title: Reno or Bust
1079857.plot: A scrapping married couple, Franklin Pangborn and Bernice Elliott, are going to Reno to get a divorce. They have a scheme in order to obtain cruelty against the husband for divorce grounds but, in the process, find out they don't really want a divorce.

1079859.title: Reproduction in Plants and Lower Animals
1079859.plot: A short film about microphotography and photomicroscopy showing the life and reproduction of single cell organisms, plants, and lower animals.

1080075.title: Rich Uncles
1080075.plot: When the rich uncle finds the bride in the company of one of her former suitors, he mistakes him for the bridegroom.

1080076.title: Road Knights
1080076.plot: Knights of the Road stage a convention.

1080078.title: Romance of the West
1080078.plot: Chasing the man who had caused the death of his sister, Jack Walsh rescues Mary Winters from the unwanted attentions of a drunk, and learns that she has been lured to Mexico by the false promises of an ex-prizefighter "Kayo" Mooney. The latter kidnaps Mary but Jack wins the showdown and Mary, and finds that Mooney is the man he was looking for.

1080079.title: Sandy the Fireman
1080079.plot: A shopkeeper and a small girl report a fire to a reluctant fireman.

1080080.title: Schoolmates
1080080.plot: Judy (Ann Christy), dresses as a boy in order to attend the ceremony where "Cudgie" (Sumner Getchell) is being inducted into a fraternity at the college. The sign over the door at the fraternity has been moved, to fool her, to a building where, unknown to the frat boys, a notorious criminal is hiding.

1080083.title: Scrags
1080083.plot: A lot terrier saves a man's daughter and finds his tramp master,

1080084.title: Screen Snapshots Series 9, No. 11
1080084.plot: Eddie Lambert leads the tour; Douglas Fairbanks Jr., and Joan Crawford return from their honeymoon trip; Carl Laemmle, Jr. welcomes Paul Whiteman to Hollywood; Edward Everett shows off his menagerie; Eddie Quillan displays his saxophone skills; other players are glimpsed.

1080104.title: Screen Snapshots Series 9, No. 14
1080104.plot: President and Mrs. Calvin Coolidge visit Jack L. Warner and Mary Pickford in Hollywood; various players are glimpsed at work on the Columbia lot; stars turn out for a Hollywood Premiere.

1080105.title: Screen Snapshots Series 9, No. 18
1080105.plot: Players Aileen Pringle and Grant Withers are seen working on the set of Soldiers and Women at Columbia; Bessie Love and John Miljan are seen at MGM; Walt Disney is shown drawing Mickey Mouse; Eddie Cantor and his family arrive in Hollywood in preparation for his work in Samuel Goldwyn's Whoopee.

1080106.title: Screen Snapshots Series 9, No. 21
1080106.plot: Buster Keaton plays in a celebrity baseball game.

1080107.title: Under the Black Wing
1080107.plot: The young front-line soldier Ando, who has just returned from World War I to his native village, inspires his villagers to fight against "class enemies."

1080108.title: Shadows of Broadway
1080108.plot: Part of the 'Casey the Cop' series featuring Irish-American police drama. With the help of his sweetheart, a priest and a rabbi, Officer Casey goes undercover as a blind, Jewish shoemaker to bust a drug ring and save his younger brother.

1080110.title: They interfere with walking
1080110.plot: The action takes place in the late 1920s Ukraine. Exposing the agent of counterrevolution penetrating the environment of Soviet scientists.

1080111.title: She Got What She Wanted
1080111.plot: Mahyna, a dissatisfied Russian peasant girl, marries Boris and comes to New York in search of "the soul of love," only to become a drudge in their cheap flat. Meanwhile, Boris, a bookshop keeper, dreams of a prosperous future from the book he is writing. Their boarder, Dave, a partner in a gambling establishment, makes a play for Mahyna; she is tempted to leave with him when Eddie, a former admirer, arrives on the scene, and the two get into constant arguments over her.

1080112.title: She's a He
1080112.plot: A tale of a married couple who dress their little boy as a girl to fool his aunt, because she said she would only leave an inheritance if they had a girl.

1080115.title: Song Paintings
1080115.plot: Two comical songs, "My First Rendezvous" and "The Best of Them Are None Too Good" interpreted by Ann Seymour.

1080116.title: Souls in Pawn
1080116.plot: Christmas causes a rich man to forgive his daughter for marrying a secretary.

1080119.title: South of Sonora
1080119.plot: Bill Tracy is a Cattleman's Protective Association agent. Working undercover on his way to Sonora, a town dominated by rustlers, saves Betty Carter from a situation, but her rancher father, believing Blackie's suggestion that Bill is a rustler, forbids her to see him. Bill and his pal Heinie Schmaltz rescue each other from rustlers' various plots and ambushes and eventually discover that Blackie, Carter's foreman, is the leader of the rustlers.

1080122.title: Spookeasy
1080122.plot: While tracking a pair of footprints, Krazy Kat walks through a spooky midnight landscape where trees, birds and clock towers play music. Then rain and lightning storms roll in. He gets into a scary house where the furniture starts attacking him, and a ghost grabs him and takes him to underground rooms where more ghosts sing and dance and get Krazy to join them.

1081459.title: Stampede
1081459.plot: When his mother is attacked and killed by a lion, infant boy Boru is adopted by a passing tribe and raised by the tribe's chief.

1081497.title: Steeplechase
1081497.plot: This entry of Universal's Sporting Youth series goes to the racetrack. The father of Cudgie (Sumner Getchell) has a horse entered in the Big Steeplechase. Judy (Ann Christy, Cudgie's girlfriend, learns that the jockey has taken a bride to throw the race, so she replaces him and wins the stock-footage race from a Universal feature film.

1081499.title: Stranger Than Fiction
1081499.plot: A farmer's sick wife dreams she shoots her housekeeper for flirting with her husband and son.

1081516.title: Sweeping Against the Winds
1081516.plot: A small textile factory down south is run by a cruel foreman that bullies and fires on whim the workers, especially the office girl who starts a day nursery for their children. He's also a part owner in the business. His methods usually scare away the man hired as the plant manager, until a replacement (secretly one of the other owners) arrives.

1081520.title: Swell People
1081520.plot: A millionaire bricklayer invites a bank president and his wife to dinner.

1081522.title: Blue Candles
1081522.plot: An urban romance about the life of a lively young lady who has shaken off conventional female modesty, provoking her social circle.

1081524.title: Take the Heir
1081524.plot: A butler impersonates his tippler boss and falls for a beautiful young maid. However, a notorious gold-digger, who thinks the butler is the wealthy young man he's impersonating, sets her sights on him.

1081525.title: Taking Ways
1081525.plot: In this Vitaphone one-reeler, husband-and-wife team Frank Orth and Ann Codee in one of the many co-starring shorts they made together for Vitaphone, Orth is one of a pair of house-burglars who take time out from their looting to make amorous advances toward the wife of the house, Ann Codee.

1081528.title: Taxi Talks
1081528.plot: Three incidents in a cab driver's day: a college boy wooing a flapper, a gold digger wooing a southern colonel, gun moll kills gangster and wants to be taken to the precinct house.

1081536.title: Terrors
1081536.plot: Scots boys tell how they tunnelled to Australia and frightened prehistoric monsters with bagpipes.

1081538.title: Terry of the 'Times'
1081538.plot: Terry Macy (Reed Howes), the son of a newspaper's founder, is assigned to investigate a mysterious warning signed '30' (newspaper term for 'The End)that has been sent to a local politician. Terry is captured at a clandestine meeting of the 'Mystic Medicants", an outlaw band, where he overhears the plans of a plot to kill his uncle, Robert Macy, publisher of the newspaper. Terry must also, according to his father's will, get married within a short period of time is he is to inherit the newspaper.

1081540.title: The 20th Amendment
1081540.plot: The year is 1950. Food comes in the form of little pills - such as a pill for eggs and another pill for bacon. Coffee comes in the form of a spritz from a spray bottle, administered by a maid. One day Haley opens the newspaper to discover that a 20th amendment has been passed, "compelling every male citizen to have as many wives as he can support...because too many unmarried men are leaving this country due to the enforcement of Prohibition, and in order to protect the American home and the country's future population." So Haley immediately opens his little black book and before you know it has gathered a whole harem, one wife for each day of the week.

1081544.title: The Baby Bandit
1081544.plot: A husband goes to a convention, where he gets entangled with a lady bandit, who passes herself off as his wife.

1081546.title: The Bard of Broadway
1081546.plot: Newspaper columnist helps finishing school students get out of trouble after the night club in which they go to see him is raided.

1081548.title: The Benefit
1081548.plot: Pressed into service, an inept comedian offers a burlesque on Helen Morgan.

1081551.title: The Canyon of Missing Men
1081551.plot: Dave Brandon (Tom Tyler) tries to break away from his life of crime, but his old gang won't let him.

1081584.title: The Cave Club
1081584.plot: Begins with night club life in the Stone Age and evolves to the modern world of 1930.

1081585.title: The Cheer Leader
1081585.plot: A college cheerleader is injured in an auto accident just before the Big Game.

1082400.title: The hunter from the crack. The shot at dawn

1083025.title: The Cheyenne Kid
1083025.plot: Buck Allen, The Cheyenne Kid, has been accused of holding up the payroll car of the Cody Dam Construction Company, and is being pursued by U.S. Marshal Utah Kane and Sheriff Hank Bates but they lose him.

1086723.title: Zamallu
1086723.plot: The Bolsheviks fight in the gorge of Zamallu to take the control of a strategically important bridge. The events of the  film involve the period of the Civil war just before the establishment of the Soviet rule in Armenia.

118130.title: East Is West
118130.plot: Ming Toy is on the auction block in China. She is saved by Billy and taken to San Francisco by Lo Sang Kee. To save her from deportation she is sold to Charlie Yong, the Chop Suey King. Billy kidnaps her with plans of marriage.

118134.title: The Widow from Chicago
118134.plot: A woman infiltrates a criminal mob to avenge her brother's death.

120835.title: The Devil to Pay!
120835.plot: Spendthrift Willie Hale again returns penniless to the family home in London. His father is none too pleased, but Willie smooth-talks him into letting him stay. At the same time he turns the charm on Dorothy Hope, whose father is big in linoleum and who, before Willie's arrival, was about to become engaged to a Russian aristocrat.

120836.title: Strictly Unconventional
120836.plot: An adaptation of W. Somerset Maugham's The Circle. A young woman married into an aristocratic English family finds life with her husband dull and decides to elope with a Canadian. However her mother-in-law, who did something similar thirty years before, tries to prevent her.

120837.title: Three Faces East
120837.plot: The action takes place during the Great War in the home of the First Lord of the Admiralty.

120838.title: The Woman Racket
120838.plot: During a raid, a cop lets a pretty speakeasy employee escape and later begins dating her. Although she loves him, his salary and dull life leave her wanting.

120933.title: Outward Bound
120933.plot: A group of strangers find themselves aboard an unmanned ship, surrounded by fog and uncertain of their destination. As they attempt to make sense of their situation, the group of passengers discover that all they have in common is that each is dead and en route to their final judgment.

13913.title: Animal Crackers
13913.plot: The well-known explorer and hunter Captain Spaulding has just returned from Africa, and is being welcomed home with a lavish party at the estate of influential society matron Mrs. Rittenhouse when a valuable painting goes missing. The intrepid Captain Spaulding attempts to solve the crime with the help of his silly secretary Horatio Jamison, while sparring with the anarchic Signor Emanuel Ravelli and his nutty sidekick The Professor.

122047.title: Ladies of Leisure
122047.plot: Kay Arnold is a gold digger who wanders from party to party with the intention of catching a rich suitor. Jerry Strong is a young man from a wealthy family who strives to succeed as an artist. What begins as a relationship of mutual convenience soon turns into something else.

122433.title: Storm Over Mont Blanc
122433.plot: In a lonely outpost atop the treacherous Mont Blanc, an intrepid scientist lives with minimal connection to the world below. Through the telegraph, Hanes (Sepp Rist) communicates with a beautiful astronomer (Leni Riefenstahl) and is occasionally visited by an airplane pilot (Ernst Udet) upon whom he depends on supplies. In the midst of a ferocious snowstorm, Hannes loses his gloves and his weather station is battered by the elements. Suffering frostbite and unable to descend the mountain, he sends out a desperate S.O.S. in the hope that someone can brave the elements and rescue him from certain death.  Eerily romantic and overshadowed by the constant threat of doom, Storm over Mont Blanc is a "quintessential " mountain film by Arnold Fanck, the genre's innovator and unparalleled master.

123459.title: Yoshie Fujiwara's Hometown
123459.plot: While returning by boat to Japan, Yoshie Fujiwara meets a rich woman who suggests him to become a singer thanks to an impresario friend of hers.

123473.title: Paramount on Parade
123473.plot: This 1930 film, a collection of songs and sketches showcasing Paramount Studios' contract stars, credits 11 directors

125027.title: Our Gang in Little Rascals Greatest Hits - 5 Uncut Comedy Classics
125027.plot: The gang's all here -- Our Gang, that is, with Spanky, Alfalfa, Jackie, Farina, Scotty, Buckwheat, Chubby, Stymie, Wheezer, Dickie, Tommy, Mary, Pete and more in uncut versions of some of their funniest episodes. A magic lamp turns two adults into new arrivals at the Happy Home Orphanage in "Shrimps for a Day," while the Rascals show a thief how to "Fly My Kite" when he tries to send their beloved Grandma to the poor farm. THe Gang is snubbed after saying "Hi Neighbor" to the new kid on the block, and Spanky has "Beginners Luck" during his debut on amateur night, before they mistake a hungry "Kid from Borneo" for Uncle George.

125660.title: Sentimental Romance
125660.plot: Romance sentimentale is a 1930 French film directed by Grigori Aleksandrov and Sergei M. Eisenstein. A short, experimental, slightly poetic montage of city and abstract images.

128383.title: The Ghost That Never Returns
128383.plot: The rebel leader Jose Real is allowed to leave prison for one day to visit his family. But it is a ruse to make him reveal the whereabouts of his rebel gang. This existential drama disguised as a saga about the proletarian struggle presents a lonely and insecure individual who is challenged to act more heroically than he is prepared to, but who constantly questions his confidence and loyalties.

129306.title: The Mystery of Puerta del Sol
129306.plot: Pompeyo and Rodolfo work in a newspaper, but they dream of becoming film actors, so they go to a casting for an American film that will be shot in Madrid for a few days; but things will not turn out as they expect…

129841.title: Farewell
129841.plot: Hella lives in a boarding house and has various romantic adventures before settling down with vacuum cleaner salesman Winkler.

129956.title: The Apache Kid's Escape
129956.plot: A former outlaw eludes the authorities by masquerading as a cowboy.

130086.title: Going Wild
130086.plot: Rollo and Lane just happen to be tossed off the train at White Beach where Robert Story -Air ace and writer- is supposed to stop. It is a case of mistaken identity as no one knows what Story looks like. So they get free room and meals at the Palm Inn and everything is going well until they want Story to fly in the race on Saturday. Rollo has never even be up in a plane, never mind fly one, so he must figure a way out. But the girls have everything bet on his winning the race. Written by Tony Fontana

130816.title: Abraham Lincoln
130816.plot: A biopic dramatizing Abraham Lincoln's life through a series of vignettes depicting its defining chapters: his romance with Ann Rutledge; his early years as a country lawyer; his marriage to Mary Todd; his debates with Stephen A. Douglas; the election of 1860; his presidency during the Civil War; and his assassination in Ford’s Theater in 1865.

134059.title: Night of Goblins
134059.plot: Spanish version of The Laurel and Hardy Murder Case and Berth Marks.

134914.title: Sally
134914.plot: Sally is an orphan who was named by the telephone exchange where she was abandoned as a baby. In the orphanage, she discovered the joy of dancing. Working as a waitress, she serves Blair (Alexander Gray), and they both fall for each other, but Blair is engaged to socialite Marcia. Sally is hired to impersonate a famous Russian dancer named Noskerova, but at that engagement, she is found to be a phoney. Undaunted, she proceeds with her life and has a show on Broadway, but she still thinks of Blair.

140050.title: Montana Moon
140050.plot: A wild-partying flapper marries a cowboy and tries to adjust to life on a western ranch.

144788.title: Pups Is Pups
144788.plot: The gang decides to enter their animals in a local pet show.

144792.title: Liliom
144792.plot: A carousel barker falls in love with a young woman. Both are fired from their jobs, and when the young woman becomes pregnant, the carousel barker tries to help pull off a robbery, which goes wrong. Because of the robbery, he dies, and after spending time in hell, is sent back to earth for one day to try to make amends.

144794.title: The Hard Guy
144794.plot: Guy and Ellen are desperate to find a way to get food and medicine for their sick child.  Job are very hard to come by during the Great Depression and many are driven to desperate measures.

146449.title: Loose Ankles
146449.plot: A grandmother's will  leaves her fortune to a few, mostly to her great-niece Ann. Ann will only receive her inheritance once she marries, with the approval of three of her stuffed-shirt relatives and without scandal. Otherwise the estate goes to the cat and dog hospital. Ann, not needing the money, rebels by seeking scandal with a gigolo.

148720.title: A Lady to Love
148720.plot: Middle-aged Napa Valley grape-grower Tony posts a marriage proposal to San Francisco waitress Lena enclosing a photo of his handsome younger brother Buck. When she gets there she overlooks his duplicity and marries him. Then she falls in love with Buck.

148861.title: The Light of Western Stars
148861.plot: A friend of Dick Bailey is killed by a mysterious assailant, whom Dick suspects to be Stack, who is in league with the crooked sheriff. Out on a spree Dick swears he will marry the first woman he sees, who happens to be Ruth Hammond, sister of his dead friend, arriving to take charge of the Hammond ranch. Revolted by his rough proposal,she fires him as the Hammond foreman and she proceeds to the ranch. Stack informs her he has purchased the ranch for the payment of the back-due taxes, and she relents and rehires Dick and his friends to aid her in her fight against Stack.

149095.title: Accused, Stand Up!
149095.plot: Paris, 30's declared professional rivalry between two stars of the musical, Yvonne and Gaby leads to dire consequences. Yvonne's body is found in the theater. Gaby's future is threatened against the judgment to which it is subjected, with a probable prison sentence.

151052.title: The Silent Enemy
151052.plot: In the Canadian Northwest, the Chippewa tribe struggles to find food before the onset of winter.

151163.title: From Stump to Ship
151163.plot: The long log drive: a spring journey down icy streams and rivers moving logs from the forest to the mill for sawing into boards, laths, and clapboards. For more than 150 years, logging techniques remained the same. Men cut trees by hand and loaded them on horse-drawn sleds to be hauled over snow to the river. Skilled river drivers maneuvered the logs downstream, risking their limbs and lives every day. This film survives as a record of the long log business.

153832.title: Little Lise
153832.plot: Victor Berthier, a good man but also a very jealous one, killed his wife in a fit of jealousy. After serving a few years in a chain gang, he is released for good behavior. He feels very happy to be able to return to Paris and to meet Lise, his daughter, again. But, to his dismay, he finds that Lise, through the fault of André, her lover and pimp, has unwillingly committed a murder.

156320.title: Our Blushing Brides
156320.plot: Three department store girls--Connie, Franky, and Gerry--share an apartment on West 91st Street in New York City. Each earns little more than 20 dollars per week. Gerry is the sensible one, but the others throw themselves at amoral rich men in an attempt to hook one and better themselves. They end up being hurt and disappointed despite Gerry's attempts to warn them.

156347.title: Follow Thru
156347.plot: Lora Moore, the club champion, loses a golf match to a woman from another golf club. Then Jerry Downs, a handsome golf pro, and his goofy friend, Jack Martin, show up. Lora takes him on as her golf teacher to work on her putt. She falls for him, but so do several other women. Meanwhile Angie Howard, Lora's friend, chases after Jack. A lot of silliness ensues.

156363.title: The Phantom of the West
156363.plot: A young man's father is murdered and the man convicted of the crime escapes prison, leaving a note intimating that seven local men know the real killer's true identity. The murdered man's son sets out to locate the seven men and find his father's slayer.

156418.title: Black flame
156418.plot: Life and drama in a gypsy camp with the groups young lady falling in love with an outsider.

156452.title: Such Men Are Dangerous
156452.plot: A wealthy and powerful industrialist changes his identity to avenge himself on the wife that spurned him on their wedding night.

157609.title: Charming Ceylon
157609.plot: This Traveltalk series short takes the viewer to the island nation when it was still a British crown colony and the name Sri Lanka was 40 years in the future.

157614.title: The Imperial City
157614.plot: A Traveltalk visit to the island nation when it was still a British crown colony and the name Sri Lanka was 40 years in the future.

157620.title: Japan in Cherry Blossom Time
157620.plot: A springtime Traveltalk visit to Japan.

158968.title: Salt for Svanetia
158968.plot: An ethnographic treasure that documents with visual bravado the harsh conditions of life in the isolated mountain village of Ushkul.

159019.title: Roseland
159019.plot: A pretty dance hall girl is looking for the right guy.

159023.title: One Good Turn
159023.plot: Singer Ruth Eton, of the singing team of Eton and Farrell, is told by her agents to get rid of her partner if she wants to advance her career. Instead, she gives him singing lessons. After a few months of training, he is good enough to be on his own and dumps Eton. When he loses his voice suddenly, he finds out who his true friends are.

162684.title: The Cuckoo Murder Case
162684.plot: The Cuckoo Bird residing in an old clock in a creepy old mansion is shot dead by an unknown assailant; Flip the Frog is called in to investigate (and finds more than he bargained for). |

162741.title: And Quiet Flows the Don
162741.plot: The first screen adaptation of an epic Russian novel about a village of Cossacks on the Don River, covering the last days of peace on the riverside before the beginning of the First World War.

162762.title: The Bat
162762.plot: Once upon a time, the birds and the beasts fought each other in a war. It was a terrible conflict, and the clever bats would side with the birds when the birds were looking victorious, and then they would become allies of the beasts when that side was winning battles. At last the war came to an end, the two parties reached an amicable settlement, and a great party of friendship was held. But when it came to the turn of the bats to perform in the program, their fence-straddling tactics were exposed, and everyone refused to associate with them. Since that time, the bats have been too ashamed to show their faces during the day, coming out only at night to flit silently around.

162791.title: The Gorilla Mystery
162791.plot: A gorilla has escaped; Mickey, panicked, calls Minnie, but she plays a song to show she is not afraid. That is, until the gorilla comes up behind her and grabs her. Mickey rushes right over to save her.

162792.title: The Shindig
162792.plot: Another barn dance. Minnie plays piano; Mickey plays fiddle, then percussion, then harmonica. Mickey dances with the huge Patricia Pig.

162794.title: The Fire Fighters
162794.plot: Mickey and others are firemen; they slide down an ostrich's neck when the alarm sounds. A squealing cat whose tail Mickey pulls acts as the siren. The nearest hydrant isn't working too well, so Horace Horsecollar takes drinks from a pond and uses that water to put out the fire. Minnie is trapped on an upper floor; Mickey climbs the neighboring building fire escape and uses a clothesline to cross to Minnie's building.

162800.title: Viennese Nights
162800.plot: In 1890, Gus Sascher joins the Austrian Army and romances the impoverished girl Elsa Hofner. Elsa instead marries the wealthier officer Franz von Renner, in an attempt at social climbing.

162804.title: Swing You Sinners!
162804.plot: Bimbo is seen late at night trying to steal a chicken. He runs away from a policeman and enters a haunted cemetery. Various ghosts and monsters harass him and tell him that he will be punished for his sin before he is chased into a cave

162874.title: The Florodora Girl
162874.plot: A chorus girl gets bad advice from her fellow chorines in handling a rich suitor who assumes she is a gold digger.

162910.title: Mysterious Mose
162910.plot: Betty Boop (with dog's ears) can't sleep on a scary night, so she sings the title song and meets the gentleman in question...a surreal version of Bimbo.

162927.title: Shivering and Shaking
162927.plot: Street musicians Stan and Ollie have no success earning money in the dead of winter in a bad neighborhood. Their instruments are destroyed in an argument with a woman, but their luck seems to turn when Stan finds a wallet.

162928.title: Let Us Be Gay
162928.plot: Dowdy housewife Kitty dotes on her self-centered husband but divorces him when his mistress shows up at their home one day to break up their marriage. Bob had become bored with her lackluster appearance, their children and himself. Kitty re-invents herself and becomes a Continental favorite, dressing like a fashion model and behaving gaily. Three years after their divorce, Bob is at the home of a wealthy matron romancing her soon-to-be-married granddaughter, when the matron invites Kitty to a weekend party to steal Bob away from the granddaughter. When Kitty and Bob see each other, neither lets on they have a past, and the party continues as Bob pursues his ex-wife and new conquest equally.

162932.title: Pioneer Days
162932.plot: Mickey and Minnie are on a wagon train; they camp for the night, unaware that Indians have spotted them and are doing a war dance. The attack comes, and Minnie is captured.

162953.title: The White Devil
162953.plot: Ivan Mozzhukhin is a "...hot-headed Caucasian mountaineer leader whose irrational behavior comes to the attention of the Czar . Hoping to use Hajji Murad as a go-between in his plans to conquer the Caucasus mountaineers, the Russian ruler finds that the hero is not so easily manipulated. Rescuing the beautiful Saira from the Czar's clutches, Hajji Murad leads the mountain people's revolt against the despotic regent." Needless to say, the film ends in tragedy.

162954.title: Walk Cheerfully
162954.plot: Kenji is a small-time thief who likes drinking and fighting. When he falls in love with sweet and simple Yazue, and she finds out what kind of guy he really is, she leaves him "until he becomes an honest person." Kenji soon finds it's not easy to get rid of one's past.

162955.title: The Matrimonial Bed
162955.plot: Five years after Adolphe's death in a train wreck, he is discovered very much alive and with amnesia. Unfortunately he and his first wife are remarried and with children.

162957.title: Manslaughter
162957.plot: A spoiled young rich girl is sent to prison for accidentally running down a pedestrian. There she learns about a life and people she had never even imagined existed before.

162959.title: The Silver Horde
162959.plot: A salmon fisherman has to choose between a bad girl and a society doll.

162963.title: Kristine Valdresdatter
162963.plot: Year after year lord Wakefield comes to Vang to fish. One summer he meets beautiful Anne and falls in love. The following spring Anne gives birth to a daughter and leaves the baby and drown herself. The local man of the law takes care of the child and calls her Kristine Valdresdatter.

162965.title: The Picnic
162965.plot: Summertime, and Mickey takes Minnie on a picnic. While Pluto is chasing a rabbit, and Mickey and Minnie are doing a courtship dance, every animal in the woods is busy making off with their picnic food. And then the rain comes.

162967.title: War Nurse
162967.plot: Untrained, volunteer Nurses from America treat Allied soldiers behind and on the lines in France. They face the horrors of war, fight off the attentions of soldiers and face their own loneliness.
